title: Recurrent issue: using `torch.ge` etc, instead of `nn.relu`
body_html:
Recurrent issue: using torch.ge etc, instead of nn.relu. eg:

  • https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/torch-ge-triggers-there-are-no-graph-nodes-that-require-computing-gradients-in-loss-function/4960
  • https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/how-to-make-the-parameter-of-torch-nn-threshold-learnable/4729
  • probably others...

Seems like maybe torch.ge should wrap nn.relu, or somehow use it, if the inputs are Variables perhaps?

(Note that i'm not intending to fix this; just flagging it for now, since comes up a lot)

Edit: well... since these calls actually go via Variable wrappers (I think?), it seems like Variable.ge etc could interecept these calls, and send them to .Threshold etc?

body:
Recurrent issue: using `torch.ge` etc, instead of `nn.relu`.  eg:
- https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/torch-ge-triggers-there-are-no-graph-nodes-that-require-computing-gradients-in-loss-function/4960
- https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/how-to-make-the-parameter-of-torch-nn-threshold-learnable/4729
- probably others...

Seems like maybe `torch.ge` should wrap `nn.relu`, or somehow use it, if the inputs are `Variable`s perhaps?

(Note that i'm not intending to fix this; just flagging it for now, since comes up a lot)

Edit: well... since these calls actually go via `Variable` wrappers (I think?), it seems like `Variable.ge` etc could interecept these calls, and send them to `.Threshold` etc?
